titles.title: Free All Speech Act of 2014
A bill to apply laws that restrict the political speech of American citizens to media corporations.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary:
6/3/2014--Introduced. Free All Speech Act of 2014 - Requires any law that restricts political speech of American citizens to apply with equal force to media corporations (such as the New York Times, the American Broadcasting Company [ABC], the National Broadcasting Company [NBC], and the CBS Television Network).
Prohibits such a law from having any force or effect with respect to American citizens to the extent that its application to a media corporation is found unconstitutional.
